# Task

Write a pig latin transformer called `pig_latinify` that operates on a vector of strings. It iterates over each string and changes it to pig latin. Each iteration should run on a separate thread.



# Data

pig_latinify(["hello", "apple", "strong", "world"])

```julia
# Solution
function pig_latinify(words)
    threads = []
    for word in words
        thread = @async begin
            pig_latinify_word(word)
            push!(threads, take!(thread))
        end
        push!(threads, thread)
    end
    return collect(threads)
end

function pig_latinify_word(word)
    # Example data: "hello", "apple", "strong", "world"
    # Create example word from word if needed
    pig_latin_word = "$(word)_"
    return p_l_word[1] == 'h' || p_l_word[1] == 'a' || p_l_word[1] == 's' ?
        (string(first(p_l_word), "ay", rest(p_l_word)) :
            string(p_l_word[1], "og", rest(p_l_word)))
end

function take!(thread)
    result = thread.value
    close(thread)
    return result
end

# Helper functions to split the word into first char and rest
first(word) = word[1]
rest(word) = word[2:end]

# Test code
words = ["hello", "apple", "strong", "world"]
expected_output = ["ello_hay", "pple_ay", "rong_sday", "orld_way"]

@test actual_output == expected_output
end
```
